Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2013 02:10PM chickydee wrote: I had just turned 52. Never felt a lump, just redness in skin on breast. OB/GYN had a good friend dx with inflammatory breast cancer so she sent me for a diagnostic mammogram. Core needle biopsy of breast and lymph node, skin punch. 4 days later, dx IBC. Stage IV. Mets to bones.

Posts.Title: In shock for a different reason - PREGNANT! Letlet kathleen1966

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2013 10:11AM chickydee wrote: chanah, how wonderful! I have been saving for 30 years for a dream trip to Hawaii with my husband and then all of this happened. Bone met pains really discourage me from making the 13 hour flight now. So instead I booked a Caribbean cruise for my family over the Christmas holiday. Guess that money was burning a hole in my pocket. I did get trip insurance. It's such fun anticipating it, and even if anything goes wrong, I still got to see the excitement in my children's eyes when I asked if they would like to go.
